req1: the target distance to be displayed on the dmi shall be based on the most restrictive braking curve
req2: the following train data shall be sent from the on board to the trackside

req1: the dmi shall indicate the result of the self-test
req2: the etcs trainborne equipment shall indicate on the dmi the information regarding pantograph and power supply

req1: when the train is stationary or after a certain time (eg the time for "route releasing" of the overlap the release speed calculation shall be based on the distance to the danger point (if calculated on-board) the condition for this change shall be defined for each target as infrastructure data
req2: if the train or the shunting movement exceeds the permitted ceiling speed by a certain harmonised margin the trainborne equipment shall execute a brake intervention until the actual speed does not exceed permitted speed; then the driver shall be able to release the brake

req1: etcs shall calculate the permitted speed for the train for all locations of the authorised movement
req2: when the train is stationary or after a certain time (eg the time for "route releasing" of the overlap the release speed calculation shall be based on the distance to the danger point (if calculated on-board) the condition for this change shall be defined for each target as infrastructure data

req1: if the train or the shunting movement exceeds the permitted ceiling speed by a certain harmonised margin the trainborne equipment shall execute a brake intervention until the actual speed does not exceed permitted speed; then the driver shall be able to release the brake
req2: when the traction unit has come to a standstill the driver shall be able to release the emergency brake

req1: the driver shall be able to select train data entry on the dmi
req2: the target distance to be displayed on the dmi shall be based on the most restrictive braking curve

req1: when the train is stationary or after a certain time (eg the time for "route releasing" of the overlap the release speed calculation shall be based on the distance to the danger point (if calculated on-board) the condition for this change shall be defined for each target as infrastructure data
req2: the new target location shall be checked for acceptance by the on board

req1: on request of the rbc the driver shall have the possibility to confirm that the track ahead of him until the end of the on sight section is clear
req2: the driver shall be able to confirm the train integrity to the rbc manually the confirmation requires the train to be stationary

req1: to prevent unauthorised use of the function permission shall be obtained from the rbc if the train is operating under the control of the rbc
req2: if there are failures of the trainborne equipment which compromise the safety of train supervision the etcs trainborne equipment shall immediately command the brake and bring the train to a stop

req1: the supervised speed shall not be shown on the dmi
req2: operation of the train trip shall be indicated on the dmi

req1: operation of the train trip shall be indicated on the dmi
req2: information shall be shown on the dmi

req1: the etcs on-board shall be capable of receiving information regarding air tightness from the trackside
req2: the following train data shall be sent from the on board to the trackside

req1: on request of the rbc the driver shall have the possibility to confirm that the track ahead of him until the end of the on sight section is clear
req2: the driver shall know the distance to the next point defining the indicated braking curve and the permitted speed allowed this shall be shown to the driver in a way that is understandable and logical

req1: it shall be possible to send information on adhesion conditions from trackside
req2: it shall also be possible to allow the driver to change the adhesion conditions; in this case information from trackside has priority

req1: if an etcs equipped train passes a level transition to a line fitted with more than one level the onboard shall switch to the highest level according to the priority given by trackside for which it is equipped
req2: if an etcs equipped train passes a level transition to one or more levels for which it is not equipped etcs shall initiate a brake application

req1: the etcs on-board shall be capable of receiving track description from the trackside
req2: the on board shall be capable of sending train data to the trackside after confirmation by the driver or when entering the rbc area

req1: the driver shall be able to consult train data when the train is stationary or moving
req2: on demand the position of the front end of the train at the time of the demand shall be indicated on the dmi this shall be possible while the train is moving or stationary

req1: when the plain text message appears on the dmi the driver shall be alerted
req2: the on board shall be capable of sending train data to the trackside after confirmation by the driver or when entering the rbc area

req1: the current operational status shall be indicated to the driver on the dmi
req2: the driver shall be able to use the reversing function without needing to re-confirm the train data

req1: the current operational status shall be indicated to the driver on the dmi
req2: information shall be shown on the dmi

req1: the etcs trainborne equipment shall be capable of receiving information from the national train control systems by means of the stm
req2: the dmi shall display or be compatible with information from national train control systems this may mean displaying the information shown by the national system

req1: where failure to apply the full service brake is detected the emergency brake shall stop the train in rear of the danger point
req2: if there are failures of the trainborne equipment which compromise the safety of train supervision the etcs trainborne equipment shall immediately command the brake and bring the train to a stop

req1: the train shall as a minimum be supervised to a ceiling speed; the supervised speed shall not be shown on the dmi unless selected by the driver
req2: when the train is stationary or after a certain time (eg the time for "route releasing" of the overlap the release speed calculation shall be based on the distance to the danger point (if calculated on-board) the condition for this change shall be defined for each target as infrastructure data

req1: when the traction unit has come to a standstill the driver shall be able to release the emergency brake
req2: the emergency brake shall be applied until the traction unit is stationary

req1: where failure to apply the full service brake is detected the emergency brake shall stop the train in rear of the danger point
req2: when the traction unit is stationary the driver shall be required to acknowledge the train trip condition this acknowledgement will release the emergency brake

req1: the current application level shall be indicated on the dmi
req2: the target distance shall not be shown on the dmi unless selected by the driver

req1: the target distance shall not be shown on the dmi unless selected by the driver
req2: the occurrence of a failure shall be displayed on the dmi

req1: the on board shall supervise the train against a ceiling speed
req2: if the train or the shunting movement exceeds the permitted ceiling speed by a certain harmonised margin the trainborne equipment shall execute a brake intervention until the actual speed does not exceed permitted speed; then the driver shall be able to release the brake

req1: when changing to a lower speed level the front end of the train shall respect the dynamic train speed profile
req2: on demand the position of the front end of the train at the time of the demand shall be indicated on the dmi this shall be possible while the train is moving or stationary

req1: if the train or the shunting movement exceeds the permitted ceiling speed by a certain harmonised margin the trainborne equipment shall execute a brake intervention until the actual speed does not exceed permitted speed; then the driver shall be able to release the brake
req2: when the traction unit is stationary the driver shall be required to acknowledge the train trip condition this acknowledgement will release the emergency brake

req1: the test shall require no action on the part of the driver
req2: when the plain text message appears on the dmi the driver shall be alerted

req1: to prevent unauthorised use of the function permission shall be obtained from the rbc if the train is operating under the control of the rbc
req2: when the train is stationary or after a certain time (eg the time for "route releasing" of the overlap the release speed calculation shall be based on the distance to the danger point (if calculated on-board) the condition for this change shall be defined for each target as infrastructure data

req1: in partial supervision the train shall be supervised according to train speed and distance data available
req2: a train shall be supervised to its static and dynamic train speed profiles
